docs.text: Class: Coding (Coding) A structured representation of a code for a defined concept in a terminology or code system. URI: sepio_linkml:Coding classDiagram class Coding click Coding href "../Coding" Utility <|-- Coding click Utility href "../Utility" Coding : code Coding : label_2 Coding : system Coding : systemVersion Inheritance Utility Coding Slots Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance code 0..1 String A symbol uniquely identifying the concept, as in a syntax defined by the code... direct label_2 0..1 String The human-readable name for the coded concept, as defined by the code system direct system 0..1 String The terminology/code system that defined the code direct systemVersion 0..1 String Version of the terminology or code system that provided the code direct Usages used by used in type used InformationEntity methodTypes range Coding InformationEntity informationQuality range Coding Method subtype range Coding Method methodTypes range Coding Method informationQuality range Coding Document subtype_2 range Coding Document methodTypes range Coding Document informationQuality range Coding DataItem subtype_3 range Coding DataItem unit range Coding DataItem methodTypes range Coding DataItem informationQuality range Coding DataSet subtype_4 range Coding DataSet methodTypes range Coding DataSet informationQuality range Coding Activity subtype_5 range Coding Contribution activityType range Coding Contribution subtype_5 range Coding Statement predicate range Coding Statement subjectClassification range Coding Statement methodTypes range Coding Statement informationQuality range Coding StudyResult interpretation range Coding StudyResult methodTypes range Coding StudyResult informationQuality range Coding EvidenceLine methodTypes range Coding EvidenceLine informationQuality range Coding Proposition predicate_2 range Coding Comments Either a code, label, or both must be provided. Coding supports use of terms form ontologies/terminologies in structured object that reports id, label, and metadata about system it came from. follows FHIR approach. Used in model when implementers are free to create own value sets of terms which get reported within coding objects in SEPIO data. Validation requires additional tooling - as constraints are not defined in schema itself. Coding supports use of terms form ontologies/terminologies in structured object that reports id, label, and metadata about system it came from. follows FHIR approach. Used in model when implementers are free to create own value sets of terms which get reported within coding objects in SEPIO data. Validation requires additional tooling - as constraints are not defined in schema itself.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml is_a: Utility slots: - code - label_2 - system - systemVersion slot_usage: code: name: code description: A symbol uniquely identifying the concept, as in a syntax defined by the code system. CURIE format is preferred where possible (e.g. ‘SO:0000704’ is the CURIE form of the Sequence Ontology code for 'gene'). range: string required: false multivalued: false label_2: name: label_2 description: The human-readable name for the coded concept, as defined by the code system. range: string required: false multivalued: false system: name: system description: The terminology/code system that defined the code. May be reported as a free-text name (e.g. ‘Sequence Ontology’), but it is preferable to provide a uri/url for the system. When the 'code' is reported as a CURIE, the 'system' should be reported as the uri that the CURIE's prefix expands to (e.g. 'http://purl.obofoundry.org/so.owl/' for the Sequence Ontology). range: string required: false multivalued: false systemVersion: name: systemVersion description: Version of the terminology or code system that provided the code. range: string required: false multivalued: false Induced name: Coding description: A structured representation of a code for a defined concept in a terminology or code system. title: Coding comments: - 'Either a code, label, or both must be provided. CURIE format is preferred where possible (e.g. ‘SO:0000704’ is the CURIE form of the Sequence Ontology code for 'gene'). range: string required: false multivalued: false label_2: name: label_2 description: The human-readable name for the coded concept, as defined by the code system. range: string required: false multivalued: false system: name: system description: The terminology/code system that defined the code. May be reported as a free-text name (e.g. ‘Sequence Ontology’), but it is preferable to provide a uri/url for the system. When the 'code' is reported as a CURIE, the 'system' should be reported as the uri that the CURIE's prefix expands to (e.g. 'http://purl.obofoundry.org/so.owl/' for the Sequence Ontology). range: string required: false multivalued: false systemVersion: name: systemVersion description: Version of the terminology or code system that provided the code. range: string required: false multivalued: false attributes: code: name: code description: A symbol uniquely identifying the concept, as in a syntax defined by the code system. The date SHOULD be formatted as a date string in ISO format "YYYY-MM-DD". from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-model status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: date owner: Contribution domain_of: - Activity range: date required: false multivalued: false performedBy: name: performedBy description: An Agent who participated in executing the Activity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: performedBy owner: Contribution domain_of: - Activity range: Agent required: false multivalued: true specifiedBy_2: name: specifiedBy_2 description: A method that was followed in performing an Activity, that describes how it was executed. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: specifiedBy_2 owner: Contribution domain_of: - Activity range: Method required: false multivalued: true input: name: input description: An entity that was input into the Activity (could be material or information) from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: input owner: Contribution domain_of: - Activity range: Entity required: false multivalued: true output: name: output description: An entity that was output from the Activity (could be material or information) from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: output owner: Contribution domain_of: - Activity range: Entity required: false multivalued: true id: name: id description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may or may not be globally unique outside the system. It is used within a system to reference one object from another. comments: - 'FHIR naming conventions concerning ''logical'' vs ''business'' identifiers are adopted here. See https://confluence.hl7.org/display/SOA/FHIR+identifiers+and+FAIR+principles+on+IDs. Note that it is common for implementers to create their own internal logical ids - typically a serially or randomly generated value like a UUID that is assigned to the data object as it is created in a system. But an implementer may choose to reuse an existing, globally unique id from an external system or authority for this purpose (e.g. an HGNC id for a Gene object) - as long as it is unique within the implementing system, and can be used to reference the identified object in this context.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: id owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: string required: true multivalued: false identifiers: name: identifiers description: A globally-unique 'business' identifier or accession number for the real-world entity represented by a data object. These are typically assigned by an external system or authority, and used to connect entities and share content across different systems. comments: - 'FHIR naming conventions concerning ''logical'' vs ''business'' identifiers are adopted here. See https://confluence.hl7.org/display/SOA/FHIR+identifiers+and+FAIR+principles+on+IDs. A given real world entity - e.g. a genetic variant - may have many business identifiers defined by different systems, which can be captured in the ''identifiers'' property to indicate that they represent the same thing. Preferred values for this attribute are CURIEs or URIs - so the system that provisioned the identifier is clear.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: identifiers owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true type: name: type description: The name of the class that is instantiated by a data object representing the Entity. comments: - MUST be the label of a concrete class from the data model. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: type owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: string required: true multivalued: false label: name: label description: A primary name for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: label owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false alternativeLabels: name: alternativeLabels description: Alternative name(s) for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: alternativeLabels owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true description: name: description description: A free text description of the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: description owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false extensions: name: extensions description: A list of extensions to the Entity, that allow for capture of information not directly supported by elements defined in the model. comments: - Extension objects have a key-value data structure that allows definition of custom fields in the data itself. Extensions are not expected to be natively understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes between systems. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: extensions owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: Extension required: false multivalued: true

docs.title: Usages

docs.text: The scope of a Contribution instance includes only the actions of a single agent in contributing to a single artifact, which may be performed in one continuous effort, or several discontinuous sessions of work. The agent can be an individual person, a software agent, or a group or organization of individuals acting together. Contribution instances are used to organize information about when, where, how (e.g. what roles were played), and on whose behalf these actions were performed.

Preferred values for this attribute are CURIEs or URIs - so the system that provisioned the identifier is clear.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: identifiers owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true type: name: type description: The name of the class that is instantiated by a data object representing the Entity. comments: - MUST be the label of a concrete class from the data model. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: type owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: string required: true multivalued: false label: name: label description: A primary name for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: label owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false alternativeLabels: name: alternativeLabels description: Alternative name(s) for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: alternativeLabels owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true description: name: description description: A free text description of the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: description owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false extensions: name: extensions description: A list of extensions to the Entity, that allow for capture of information not directly supported by elements defined in the model. comments: - Extension objects have a key-value data structure that allows definition of custom fields in the data itself. Extensions are not expected to be natively understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes between systems. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: extensions owner: Contribution domain_of: - Entity range: Extension required: false multivalued: true

Implementers can define their own set of data item type codes/terms, to match the needs of the domain or application. status: Informative range: Coding required: false multivalued: false value: name: value description: The value of the data item (could be quantitative or qualitative depending on the type of data item). status: Informative range: string required: true multivalued: false unit: name: unit description: A unit of measure for the value (e.g. meters, grams, fluorescent units, seconds, mg/ml, etc.) comments: - Implementers should define a relevant source or specific set of unit terms/codes to use here based on the needs of the domain or application. status: Informative range: Coding required: false multivalued: false variabilityMeasures: name: variabilityMeasures description: A statistical score describing the variability inherent in a data item representing a statistical summary of a set of observations/measurements (e.g. the standard deviation associated with a statistical mean calculated across several experimental replicates). comments: - Examples of statistical measures of variability include an Interquartile Range, Variance, Standard Deviation, Standard Error. The type of variability measure used here represents should be reported in the DataItem instance created to represent it. status: Informative range: DataItem required: false multivalued: true confidenceInterval: name: confidenceInterval description: A measure of the probability that a parameter of interest will fall within a defined range of values around a mean or other statistical calculation. comments: - 'Confidence intervals reflect the degree of uncertainty in a sampling method. They may be bounded on one or both sides, and are computed for a designated confidence level (most often 95% or 99%.. For example, a Hazard Ratio of 0.47 might have a 95% confidence interval between 0.42 and 0.55, with a p-value of = 0.001. The DataItem used to represent a confidence interval will indicate what type of interval is reported (e.g. ''95% CI''), and will contain separate componentDataItems representing the upper and lower bounds of the interval (e.g. ''0.42'' and ''0.55'').' status: Informative range: DataItem required: false multivalued: false componentDataItem: name: componentDataItem description: A more foundational data item that is a logical component of a compound data item. comments: - Examples of 'compound' data items with component parts include a confidence interval, which is comprised of data items representing its lower and upper bounds, or a blood pressure reading, which is comprised of separate systolic and diastolic measurements. status: Informative range: DataItem required: false multivalued: true Induced name: DataItem description: An Information Entity representing an individual piece of data, generated or acquired through methods which reliably produce truthful information about something. title: Data Item comments: - Examples include raw observations or measurements such as an allele count, or patient's weight, derived calculations such as frequency or mean, and computed statistical scores/metrics such as p-values and z-scores. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative is_a: InformationEntity slot_usage: subtype_3: name: subtype_3 description: A specific type of data the DataItem instance represents (e.g. a 'specimen count', a 'patient weight', an 'allele frequency', a 'p-value') comments: - This attribute can be used to report a specific type for the DataItem, in cases where a model does not define DataItem subclasses for this purpose. DataItem range: DataItem required: false multivalued: false componentDataItem: name: componentDataItem description: A more foundational data item that is a logical component of a compound data item. comments: - Examples of 'compound' data items with component parts include a confidence interval, which is comprised of data items representing its lower and upper bounds, or a blood pressure reading, which is comprised of separate systolic and diastolic measurements. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: componentDataItem owner: DataItem domain_of: - DataItem range: DataItem required: false multivalued: true isAbout: name: isAbout description: An entity or concept in the world that the information entity describes/is about. comments: - When used in the context of a Statement object, this field can be used to indicate entities/concepts it is about, in lieu of providing a more precise description of what the Statement asserts to be true using subject, predicate, object, and qualifier properties. e.g. the Statement that "BRCA2 c.8023A>G is pathogenic for Breast Cancer" might be annotated to be about the variant 'BRCA2 c.8023A>G', and the disease 'Breast Cancer'. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: isAbout owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: true contributions: name: contributions description: Specific actions taken by an Agent toward the creation, modification, validation, or deprecation of an Information Entity. comments: - This attribute holds one or more Contribution objects, which provide structured descriptions of a contribution made to the Information Entity by a particular agent. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: contributions owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: Contribution required: false multivalued: true dateAuthored: name: dateAuthored description: Indicates when the information content expressed in the Information Entity was generated. comments: - The term 'authored' as used in the model refers to the generation of 'information content' in the abstract sense, as opposed to a concrete encoding of this information in a specific language or format. e.g. for a Statement, this attribute captures when the information content expressed in the Statement was first generated by an agent. Information about when a particular concrete encoding of this information was created (e.g. as a written sentence, or a json object) would live in a RecordMetadata object attached to the Information Entity). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: dateAuthored owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: false specifiedBy: name: specifiedBy description: A specification that describes all or part of the process that led to creation of the Information Entity (e.g. a specific experimental protocol or data analysis specification that describe how data were generated, or an evidence interpretation guideline that describes steps taken to interpret data in making a variant pathogenicity classification). comments: - Note that this attribute captures specific *instances* of specifications/methods (e.g. the specific electron microscopy method described in https://doi.org/10.1002/ cpz1.1045) - as opposed to reporting a *type* of method applied (e.g. 'Transmission Electron Microscopy'). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: specifiedBy owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: true methodTypes: name: methodTypes description: Types of methodological approaches used to collect, generate, or evaluate the reported information. comments: - 'This field captures terms representing *types* of methods applied, vs the ''specifiedBy'' attribute which captures specific instances of methods used. Implementers should define a relevant source or specific set of method type codes/terms to use here based on the needs of the domain or application.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: methodTypes owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: Coding required: false multivalued: true derivedFrom: name: derivedFrom description: Another Information Entity from which this Information Entity is derived, in whole or in part from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: derivedFrom owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: InformationEntity required: false multivalued: true reportedIn: name: reportedIn description: A document in which the Information Entity is reported comments: - The term 'authored' is used in the model to refer to the generation of abstract 'information content', as opposed to creation of a concrete encoding of this information in a specific language, format, or physical artifact. e.g. for a Statement, this attribute captures when the information content expressed in the Statement was first generated by an agent, and metadata about when a particular concrete encoding of this information was created (e.g. a written sentence in an article, or json object in a data stream) would live in a RecordMetadata object attached to the Information Entity). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: reportedIn owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: true informationQuality: name: informationQuality description: A qualitative term indicating the scientific rigor or reliability with which the information was generated/collected. comments: - '- This is typically based on the quality of design and execution of the study or curation activity that generated it (e.g. were relevant controls assessed to show instruments were working, were all samples taken care of and handled identically, are methods sound and well documented, etc.). - The quality of information is intrinsic to the information itself, and not to a particular application of the information (e.g. as evidence for making an Assertion) - The quality of information is one factor that goes into the confidence we have in the information''s veracity (i.e. that it is an accurate reflection of reality it intends to measure or describe). Other factors informing confidence may include who did it (we may just not trust some Agents), when (if data created 500 years ago, we may have less confidence in it), and for Assertions, the relevance and abundance of supporting evidence. - Implementers should define a relevant source or specific set of terms to use here based on the needs of the domain or application.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: informationQuality owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: Coding required: false multivalued: false recordMetadata: name: recordMetadata description: Provenance metadata about a specific concrete encoding/serialization of information (e.g. as a record in a specific data/knowledgebase, or an online digital resource) - as opposed to provenance about the abstract information content a record carries. comments: - This attribute holds a structured RecordMetadata objects, which can be used to capture when, how, and by whom a record serialization was generated or modified; what upstream resources it was derived or retrieved from; and record-level administrative information such as versioning and lifecycle status. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: recordMetadata owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: RecordMetadata required: false multivalued: false id: name: id description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may or may not be globally unique outside the system. It is used within a system to reference one object from another. comments: - 'FHIR naming conventions concerning ''logical'' vs ''business'' identifiers are adopted here. See https://confluence.hl7.org/display/SOA/FHIR+identifiers+and+FAIR+principles+on+IDs. Note that it is common for implementers to create their own internal logical ids - typically a serially or randomly generated value like a UUID that is assigned to the data object as it is created in a system. But an implementer may choose to reuse an existing, globally unique id from an external system or authority for this purpose (e.g. an HGNC id for a Gene object) - as long as it is unique within the implementing system, and can be used to reference the identified object in this context.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: id owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: true multivalued: false identifiers: name: identifiers description: A globally-unique 'business' identifier or accession number for the real-world entity represented by a data object. These are typically assigned by an external system or authority, and used to connect entities and share content across different systems. comments: - 'FHIR naming conventions concerning ''logical'' vs ''business'' identifiers are adopted here. See https://confluence.hl7.org/display/SOA/FHIR+identifiers+and+FAIR+principles+on+IDs. A given real world entity - e.g. a genetic variant - may have many business identifiers defined by different systems, which can be captured in the ''identifiers'' property to indicate that they represent the same thing. Preferred values for this attribute are CURIEs or URIs - so the system that provisioned the identifier is clear.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: identifiers owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true type: name: type description: The name of the class that is instantiated by a data object representing the Entity. comments: - MUST be the label of a concrete class from the data model. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: type owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: true multivalued: false label: name: label description: A primary name for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: label owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false alternativeLabels: name: alternativeLabels description: Alternative name(s) for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: alternativeLabels owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true description: name: description description: A free text description of the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: description owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false extensions: name: extensions description: A list of extensions to the Entity, that allow for capture of information not directly supported by elements defined in the model. comments: - Extension objects have a key-value data structure that allows definition of custom fields in the data itself. Extensions are not expected to be natively understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes between systems. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: extensions owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: Extension required: false multivalued: true

docs.text: name: DataItem description: An Information Entity representing an individual piece of data, generated or acquired through methods which reliably produce truthful information about something. title: Data Item comments: - Examples include raw observations or measurements such as an allele count, or patient's weight, derived calculations such as frequency or mean, and computed statistical scores/metrics such as p-values and z-scores. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative is_a: InformationEntity slots: - subtype_3 - value - unit - variabilityMeasures - confidenceInterval - componentDataItem slot_usage: subtype_3: name: subtype_3 description: A specific type of data the DataItem instance represents (e.g. a 'specimen count', a 'patient weight', an 'allele frequency', a 'p-value') comments: - This attribute can be used to report a specific type for the DataItem, in cases where a model does not define DataItem subclasses for this purpose. Implementers can define their own set of data item type codes/terms, to match the needs of the domain or application. status: Informative range: Coding required: false multivalued: false value: name: value description: The value of the data item (could be quantitative or qualitative depending on the type of data item). status: Informative range: string required: true multivalued: false unit: name: unit description: A unit of measure for the value (e.g. meters, grams, fluorescent units, seconds, mg/ml, etc.) comments: - Implementers should define a relevant source or specific set of unit terms/codes to use here based on the needs of the domain or application. status: Informative range: Coding required: false multivalued: false variabilityMeasures: name: variabilityMeasures description: A statistical score describing the variability inherent in a data item representing a statistical summary of a set of observations/measurements (e.g. the standard deviation associated with a statistical mean calculated across several experimental replicates). comments: - Examples of statistical measures of variability include an Interquartile Range, Variance, Standard Deviation, Standard Error. The type of variability measure used here represents should be reported in the DataItem instance created to represent it. status: Informative range: DataItem required: false multivalued: true confidenceInterval: name: confidenceInterval description: A measure of the probability that a parameter of interest will fall within a defined range of values around a mean or other statistical calculation. comments: - 'Confidence intervals reflect the degree of uncertainty in a sampling method. They may be bounded on one or both sides, and are computed for a designated confidence level (most often 95% or 99%.. For example, a Hazard Ratio of 0.47 might have a 95% confidence interval between 0.42 and 0.55, with a p-value of = 0.001. The DataItem used to represent a confidence interval will indicate what type of interval is reported (e.g. ''95% CI''), and will contain separate componentDataItems representing the upper and lower bounds of the interval (e.g. ''0.42'' and ''0.55'').' status: Informative range: DataItem required: false multivalued: false componentDataItem: name: componentDataItem description: A more foundational data item that is a logical component of a compound data item. comments: - Examples of 'compound' data items with component parts include a confidence interval, which is comprised of data items representing its lower and upper bounds, or a blood pressure reading, which is comprised of separate systolic and diastolic measurements. status: Informative range: DataItem required: false multivalued: true

They may be bounded on one or both sides, and are computed for a designated confidence level (most often 95% or 99%.. For example, a Hazard Ratio of 0.47 might have a 95% confidence interval between 0.42 and 0.55, with a p-value of = 0.001. The DataItem used to represent a confidence interval will indicate what type of interval is reported (e.g. ''95% CI''), and will contain separate componentDataItems representing the upper and lower bounds of the interval (e.g. ''0.42'' and ''0.55'').' status: Informative range: DataItem required: false multivalued: false componentDataItem: name: componentDataItem description: A more foundational data item that is a logical component of a compound data item. comments: - Examples of 'compound' data items with component parts include a confidence interval, which is comprised of data items representing its lower and upper bounds, or a blood pressure reading, which is comprised of separate systolic and diastolic measurements. status: Informative range: DataItem required: false multivalued: true attributes: subtype_3: name: subtype_3 description: A specific type of data the DataItem instance represents (e.g. a 'specimen count', a 'patient weight', an 'allele frequency', a 'p-value') comments: - This attribute can be used to report a specific type for the DataItem, in cases where a model does not define DataItem subclasses for this purpose. The type of variability measure used here represents should be reported in the DataItem instance created to represent it. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: variabilityMeasures owner: DataItem domain_of: - DataItem range: DataItem required: false multivalued: true confidenceInterval: name: confidenceInterval description: A measure of the probability that a parameter of interest will fall within a defined range of values around a mean or other statistical calculation. comments: - 'Confidence intervals reflect the degree of uncertainty in a sampling method. They may be bounded on one or both sides, and are computed for a designated confidence level (most often 95% or 99%.. For example, a Hazard Ratio of 0.47 might have a 95% confidence interval between 0.42 and 0.55, with a p-value of = 0.001. The DataItem used to represent a confidence interval will indicate what type of interval is reported (e.g. ''95% CI''), and will contain separate componentDataItems representing the upper and lower bounds of the interval (e.g. ''0.42'' and ''0.55'').' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: confidenceInterval owner: DataItem domain_of: - DataItem range: DataItem required: false multivalued: false componentDataItem: name: componentDataItem description: A more foundational data item that is a logical component of a compound data item. comments: - Examples of 'compound' data items with component parts include a confidence interval, which is comprised of data items representing its lower and upper bounds, or a blood pressure reading, which is comprised of separate systolic and diastolic measurements. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: componentDataItem owner: DataItem domain_of: - DataItem range: DataItem required: false multivalued: true isAbout: name: isAbout description: An entity or concept in the world that the information entity describes/is about. comments: - When used in the context of a Statement object, this field can be used to indicate entities/concepts it is about, in lieu of providing a more precise description of what the Statement asserts to be true using subject, predicate, object, and qualifier properties. e.g. the Statement that "BRCA2 c.8023A>G is pathogenic for Breast Cancer" might be annotated to be about the variant 'BRCA2 c.8023A>G', and the disease 'Breast Cancer'. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: isAbout owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: true contributions: name: contributions description: Specific actions taken by an Agent toward the creation, modification, validation, or deprecation of an Information Entity. comments: - This attribute holds one or more Contribution objects, which provide structured descriptions of a contribution made to the Information Entity by a particular agent. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: contributions owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: Contribution required: false multivalued: true dateAuthored: name: dateAuthored description: Indicates when the information content expressed in the Information Entity was generated. comments: - The term 'authored' as used in the model refers to the generation of 'information content' in the abstract sense, as opposed to a concrete encoding of this information in a specific language or format. e.g. for a Statement, this attribute captures when the information content expressed in the Statement was first generated by an agent. Information about when a particular concrete encoding of this information was created (e.g. as a written sentence, or a json object) would live in a RecordMetadata object attached to the Information Entity). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: dateAuthored owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: false specifiedBy: name: specifiedBy description: A specification that describes all or part of the process that led to creation of the Information Entity (e.g. a specific experimental protocol or data analysis specification that describe how data were generated, or an evidence interpretation guideline that describes steps taken to interpret data in making a variant pathogenicity classification). comments: - Note that this attribute captures specific *instances* of specifications/methods (e.g. the specific electron microscopy method described in https://doi.org/10.1002/ cpz1.1045) - as opposed to reporting a *type* of method applied (e.g. 'Transmission Electron Microscopy'). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: specifiedBy owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: true methodTypes: name: methodTypes description: Types of methodological approaches used to collect, generate, or evaluate the reported information. comments: - 'This field captures terms representing *types* of methods applied, vs the ''specifiedBy'' attribute which captures specific instances of methods used. Implementers should define a relevant source or specific set of method type codes/terms to use here based on the needs of the domain or application.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: methodTypes owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: Coding required: false multivalued: true derivedFrom: name: derivedFrom description: Another Information Entity from which this Information Entity is derived, in whole or in part from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: derivedFrom owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: InformationEntity required: false multivalued: true reportedIn: name: reportedIn description: A document in which the Information Entity is reported comments: - The term 'authored' is used in the model to refer to the generation of abstract 'information content', as opposed to creation of a concrete encoding of this information in a specific language, format, or physical artifact. e.g. for a Statement, this attribute captures when the information content expressed in the Statement was first generated by an agent, and metadata about when a particular concrete encoding of this information was created (e.g. a written sentence in an article, or json object in a data stream) would live in a RecordMetadata object attached to the Information Entity). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: reportedIn owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: true informationQuality: name: informationQuality description: A qualitative term indicating the scientific rigor or reliability with which the information was generated/collected. comments: - '- This is typically based on the quality of design and execution of the study or curation activity that generated it (e.g. were relevant controls assessed to show instruments were working, were all samples taken care of and handled identically, are methods sound and well documented, etc.). - The quality of information is intrinsic to the information itself, and not to a particular application of the information (e.g. as evidence for making an Assertion) - The quality of information is one factor that goes into the confidence we have in the information''s veracity (i.e. that it is an accurate reflection of reality it intends to measure or describe). Other factors informing confidence may include who did it (we may just not trust some Agents), when (if data created 500 years ago, we may have less confidence in it), and for Assertions, the relevance and abundance of supporting evidence. - Implementers should define a relevant source or specific set of terms to use here based on the needs of the domain or application.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: informationQuality owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: Coding required: false multivalued: false recordMetadata: name: recordMetadata description: Provenance metadata about a specific concrete encoding/serialization of information (e.g. as a record in a specific data/knowledgebase, or an online digital resource) - as opposed to provenance about the abstract information content a record carries. comments: - This attribute holds a structured RecordMetadata objects, which can be used to capture when, how, and by whom a record serialization was generated or modified; what upstream resources it was derived or retrieved from; and record-level administrative information such as versioning and lifecycle status. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: recordMetadata owner: DataItem domain_of: - InformationEntity range: RecordMetadata required: false multivalued: false id: name: id description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may or may not be globally unique outside the system. It is used within a system to reference one object from another. comments: - 'FHIR naming conventions concerning ''logical'' vs ''business'' identifiers are adopted here. See https://confluence.hl7.org/display/SOA/FHIR+identifiers+and+FAIR+principles+on+IDs. Note that it is common for implementers to create their own internal logical ids - typically a serially or randomly generated value like a UUID that is assigned to the data object as it is created in a system. But an implementer may choose to reuse an existing, globally unique id from an external system or authority for this purpose (e.g. an HGNC id for a Gene object) - as long as it is unique within the implementing system, and can be used to reference the identified object in this context.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: id owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: true multivalued: false identifiers: name: identifiers description: A globally-unique 'business' identifier or accession number for the real-world entity represented by a data object. These are typically assigned by an external system or authority, and used to connect entities and share content across different systems. comments: - 'FHIR naming conventions concerning ''logical'' vs ''business'' identifiers are adopted here. See https://confluence.hl7.org/display/SOA/FHIR+identifiers+and+FAIR+principles+on+IDs. A given real world entity - e.g. a genetic variant - may have many business identifiers defined by different systems, which can be captured in the ''identifiers'' property to indicate that they represent the same thing. Preferred values for this attribute are CURIEs or URIs - so the system that provisioned the identifier is clear.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: identifiers owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true type: name: type description: The name of the class that is instantiated by a data object representing the Entity. comments: - MUST be the label of a concrete class from the data model. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: type owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: true multivalued: false label: name: label description: A primary name for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: label owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false alternativeLabels: name: alternativeLabels description: Alternative name(s) for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: alternativeLabels owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true description: name: description description: A free text description of the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: description owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false extensions: name: extensions description: A list of extensions to the Entity, that allow for capture of information not directly supported by elements defined in the model. comments: - Extension objects have a key-value data structure that allows definition of custom fields in the data itself. Extensions are not expected to be natively understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes between systems. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: extensions owner: DataItem domain_of: - Entity range: Extension required: false multivalued: true

docs.text: Class: Data Set (DataSet) A collection of related data items or records that are organized together in a common format or structure, to enable their computational manipulation as a unit. Entity Usages used by used in type used StudyResult sourceDataSet range DataSet Comments Instances of this class represent a specific version of a given dataset. Examples include the gnomAD version 3.1.2 dataset carrying allele population frequencies, or a specific version of a VCF file that describes variations observed in a particular patient and various annotations made on them, or a SIFT dataset of computational predictions functional impact for a set of variants. It refers to when the data set was released, which may be different than the data set was generated. status: Informative range: date required: false multivalued: false version: name: version description: The version of the DataSet, as assigned by its creator. comments: - This property can capture version information for resources such as data sets and documents that get published and released as a unit for community use. The term 'authored' as used in the model refers to the generation of 'information content' in the abstract sense, as opposed to a concrete encoding of this information in a specific language or format. e.g. for a Statement, this attribute captures when the information content expressed in the Statement was first generated by an agent. Information about when a particular concrete encoding of this information was created (e.g. as a written sentence, or a json object) would live in a RecordMetadata object attached to the Information Entity). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: dateAuthored owner: DataSet domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: false specifiedBy: name: specifiedBy description: A specification that describes all or part of the process that led to creation of the Information Entity (e.g. a specific experimental protocol or data analysis specification that describe how data were generated, or an evidence interpretation guideline that describes steps taken to interpret data in making a variant pathogenicity classification). comments: - Note that this attribute captures specific *instances* of specifications/methods (e.g. the specific electron microscopy method described in https://doi.org/10.1002/ cpz1.1045) - as opposed to reporting a *type* of method applied (e.g. 'Transmission Electron Microscopy'). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: specifiedBy owner: DataSet domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: true methodTypes: name: methodTypes description: Types of methodological approaches used to collect, generate, or evaluate the reported information. comments: - 'This field captures terms representing *types* of methods applied, vs the ''specifiedBy'' attribute which captures specific instances of methods used. Implementers should define a relevant source or specific set of method type codes/terms to use here based on the needs of the domain or application.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: methodTypes owner: DataSet domain_of: - InformationEntity range: Coding required: false multivalued: true derivedFrom: name: derivedFrom description: Another Information Entity from which this Information Entity is derived, in whole or in part from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: derivedFrom owner: DataSet domain_of: - InformationEntity range: InformationEntity required: false multivalued: true reportedIn: name: reportedIn description: A document in which the Information Entity is reported comments: - The term 'authored' is used in the model to refer to the generation of abstract 'information content', as opposed to creation of a concrete encoding of this information in a specific language, format, or physical artifact. e.g. for a Statement, this attribute captures when the information content expressed in the Statement was first generated by an agent, and metadata about when a particular concrete encoding of this information was created (e.g. a written sentence in an article, or json object in a data stream) would live in a RecordMetadata object attached to the Information Entity). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: reportedIn owner: DataSet domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: true informationQuality: name: informationQuality description: A qualitative term indicating the scientific rigor or reliability with which the information was generated/collected. comments: - '- This is typically based on the quality of design and execution of the study or curation activity that generated it (e.g. were relevant controls assessed to show instruments were working, were all samples taken care of and handled identically, are methods sound and well documented, etc.). - The quality of information is intrinsic to the information itself, and not to a particular application of the information (e.g. as evidence for making an Assertion) - The quality of information is one factor that goes into the confidence we have in the information''s veracity (i.e. that it is an accurate reflection of reality it intends to measure or describe). Other factors informing confidence may include who did it (we may just not trust some Agents), when (if data created 500 years ago, we may have less confidence in it), and for Assertions, the relevance and abundance of supporting evidence. - Implementers should define a relevant source or specific set of terms to use here based on the needs of the domain or application.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: informationQuality owner: DataSet domain_of: - InformationEntity range: Coding required: false multivalued: false recordMetadata: name: recordMetadata description: Provenance metadata about a specific concrete encoding/serialization of information (e.g. as a record in a specific data/knowledgebase, or an online digital resource) - as opposed to provenance about the abstract information content a record carries. comments: - This attribute holds a structured RecordMetadata objects, which can be used to capture when, how, and by whom a record serialization was generated or modified; what upstream resources it was derived or retrieved from; and record-level administrative information such as versioning and lifecycle status. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: recordMetadata owner: DataSet domain_of: - InformationEntity range: RecordMetadata required: false multivalued: false id: name: id description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may or may not be globally unique outside the system. It is used within a system to reference one object from another. comments: - 'FHIR naming conventions concerning ''logical'' vs ''business'' identifiers are adopted here. See https://confluence.hl7.org/display/SOA/FHIR+identifiers+and+FAIR+principles+on+IDs. Note that it is common for implementers to create their own internal logical ids - typically a serially or randomly generated value like a UUID that is assigned to the data object as it is created in a system. But an implementer may choose to reuse an existing, globally unique id from an external system or authority for this purpose (e.g. an HGNC id for a Gene object) - as long as it is unique within the implementing system, and can be used to reference the identified object in this context.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: id owner: DataSet domain_of: - Entity range: string required: true multivalued: false identifiers: name: identifiers description: A globally-unique 'business' identifier or accession number for the real-world entity represented by a data object. These are typically assigned by an external system or authority, and used to connect entities and share content across different systems. comments: - 'FHIR naming conventions concerning ''logical'' vs ''business'' identifiers are adopted here. See https://confluence.hl7.org/display/SOA/FHIR+identifiers+and+FAIR+principles+on+IDs. A given real world entity - e.g. a genetic variant - may have many business identifiers defined by different systems, which can be captured in the ''identifiers'' property to indicate that they represent the same thing. Preferred values for this attribute are CURIEs or URIs - so the system that provisioned the identifier is clear.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: identifiers owner: DataSet domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true type: name: type description: The name of the class that is instantiated by a data object representing the Entity. comments: - MUST be the label of a concrete class from the data model. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: type owner: DataSet domain_of: - Entity range: string required: true multivalued: false label: name: label description: A primary name for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: label owner: DataSet domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false alternativeLabels: name: alternativeLabels description: Alternative name(s) for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: alternativeLabels owner: DataSet domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true description: name: description description: A free text description of the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: description owner: DataSet domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false extensions: name: extensions description: A list of extensions to the Entity, that allow for capture of information not directly supported by elements defined in the model. comments: - Extension objects have a key-value data structure that allows definition of custom fields in the data itself. Extensions are not expected to be natively understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes between systems. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: extensions owner: DataSet domain_of: - Entity range: Extension required: false multivalued: true

docs.text: A collection of related data items or records that are organized together in a common format or structure, to enable their computational manipulation as a unit. docs.title: Usages

docs.text: Instances of this class represent a specific version of a given dataset. Examples include the gnomAD version 3.1.2 dataset carrying allele population frequencies, or a specific version of a VCF file that describes variations observed in a particular patient and various annotations made on them, or a SIFT dataset of computational predictions functional impact for a set of variants.

docs.text: name: DataSet description: A collection of related data items or records that are organized together in a common format or structure, to enable their computational manipulation as a unit. title: Data Set comments: - Instances of this class represent a specific version of a given dataset. Examples include the gnomAD version 3.1.2 dataset carrying allele population frequencies, or a specific version of a VCF file that describes variations observed in a particular patient and various annotations made on them, or a SIFT dataset of computational predictions functional impact for a set of variants. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft is_a: InformationEntity slots: - subtype_4 - releaseDate - version - license_2 slot_usage: subtype_4: name: subtype_4 description: A specific type of data set the DataSet instance represents (e.g. a 'clinical data set', a 'sequencing data set', a 'gene expression data set', a 'genome annotation data set') comments: - This attribute can be used to report a specific type for the DataSet, in cases where a model does not define DataSet subclasses for this purpose. Implementers can define their own set of data set type codes/terms, to match the needs of the domain or application. status: Informative range: Coding required: false multivalued: false releaseDate: name: releaseDate description: Indicates when a version of a DataSet was formally released. comments: - This attribute may apply to version and distribution-level DataSet representations. It refers to when the data set was released, which may be different than the data set was generated. status: Informative range: date required: false multivalued: false version: name: version description: The version of the DataSet, as assigned by its creator. comments: - This property can capture version information for resources such as data sets and documents that get published and released as a unit for community use. These may go through rounds of revisions that add or modify content, but don’t change the identity of the resource. Use this attribute in cases where version is not reflected in an identifier associated with the data set status: Informative range: string required: false multivalued: false license_2: name: license_2 description: A specific license that dictates legal permissions for how a data set can be used (by whom, where, for what purposes, with what additional requirements, etc.) comments: - Where possible, provide a URL pointing to the license or a description of it (e.g. "https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/"). Otherwise, provide a free-text name or description of the license (e.g. "CC-BY"). status: Informative range: string required: false multivalued: false

A single Document instance can simultaneously be concretized in different languages, formats, and physical mediums. A single Document instance can simultaneously be concretized in different languages, formats, and physical mediums. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft is_a: InformationEntity slots: - subtype_2 - title - urls_2 - pmid - doi - license slot_usage: subtype_2: name: subtype_2 description: A specific type of document that a Document instance represents (e.g. 'publication', 'patent', 'pathology report') comments: - This attribute can be used to report a specific type for the Document, in cases where a model does not define Document subclasses for this purpose. Implementers can define their own set of document type codes/terms, to match the needs of the domain or application. status: Draft range: Coding required: false multivalued: false title: name: title description: The official title given to the document by its authors. range: string required: false multivalued: false urls_2: name: urls_2 description: The URL/web address from which the content of the Document can be retrieved. status: Draft range: string required: false multivalued: true pmid: name: pmid description: A `PubMed unique identifier <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PubMed#PubMed_identifier>`_ for the document. status: Draft range: string required: false multivalued: false doi: name: doi description: A `Digital Object Identifier <https://www.doi.org/the-identifier/what-is-a-doi/>_` for the document. status: Draft range: string required: false multivalued: false license: name: license description: A specific license that dictates legal permissions for how a document can be used (by whom, where, for what purposes, with what additional requirements, etc.) comments: - Where possible, provide a URL pointing to the license or a description of it (e.g. "https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/"). Otherwise, provide a free-text name or description of the license (e.g. "CC-BY"). status: Informative range: string required: false multivalued: false Induced name: Document description: A collection of information, usually in a text-based or graphic human-readable form, intended to be read and understood together as a whole. title: Document comments: - As an abstract InformationEntity, a Document instance is defined by the informational content it conveys, not a particular physical concretization of this information. A single Document instance can simultaneously be concretized in different languages, formats, and physical mediums. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft is_a: InformationEntity slot_usage: subtype_2: name: subtype_2 description: A specific type of document that a Document instance represents (e.g. 'publication', 'patent', 'pathology report') comments: - This attribute can be used to report a specific type for the Document, in cases where a model does not define Document subclasses for this purpose. Implementers can define their own set of document type codes/terms, to match the needs of the domain or application. status: Draft range: Coding required: false multivalued: false title: name: title description: The official title given to the document by its authors. range: string required: false multivalued: false urls_2: name: urls_2 description: The URL/web address from which the content of the Document can be retrieved. status: Draft range: string required: false multivalued: true pmid: name: pmid description: A `PubMed unique identifier <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PubMed#PubMed_identifier>`_ for the document. status: Draft range: string required: false multivalued: false doi: name: doi description: A `Digital Object Identifier <https://www.doi.org/the-identifier/what-is-a-doi/>_` for the document. status: Draft range: string required: false multivalued: false license: name: license description: A specific license that dictates legal permissions for how a document can be used (by whom, where, for what purposes, with what additional requirements, etc.) comments: - Where possible, provide a URL pointing to the license or a description of it (e.g. "https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/"). Otherwise, provide a free-text name or description of the license (e.g. "CC-BY"). status: Informative range: string required: false multivalued: false attributes: subtype_2: name: subtype_2 description: A specific type of document that a Document instance represents (e.g. 'publication', 'patent', 'pathology report') comments: - This attribute can be used to report a specific type for the Document, in cases where a model does not define Document subclasses for this purpose. Implementers can define their own set of document type codes/terms, to match the needs of the domain or application. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: subtype_2 owner: Document domain_of: - Document range: Coding required: false multivalued: false title: name: title description: The official title given to the document by its authors. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml rank: 1000 alias: title owner: Document domain_of: - Document range: string required: false multivalued: false urls_2: name: urls_2 description: The URL/web address from which the content of the Document can be retrieved. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: urls_2 owner: Document domain_of: - Document range: string required: false multivalued: true pmid: name: pmid description: A `PubMed unique identifier <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PubMed#PubMed_identifier>`_ for the document. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: pmid owner: Document domain_of: - Document range: string required: false multivalued: false doi: name: doi description: A `Digital Object Identifier <https://www.doi.org/the-identifier/what-is-a-doi/>_` for the document. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: doi owner: Document domain_of: - Document range: string required: false multivalued: false license: name: license description: A specific license that dictates legal permissions for how a document can be used (by whom, where, for what purposes, with what additional requirements, etc.) comments: - Where possible, provide a URL pointing to the license or a description of it (e.g. "https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/"). Otherwise, provide a free-text name or description of the license (e.g. "CC-BY"). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: license owner: Document domain_of: - Document range: string required: false multivalued: false isAbout: name: isAbout description: An entity or concept in the world that the information entity describes/is about. comments: - When used in the context of a Statement object, this field can be used to indicate entities/concepts it is about, in lieu of providing a more precise description of what the Statement asserts to be true using subject, predicate, object, and qualifier properties. e.g. the Statement that "BRCA2 c.8023A>G is pathogenic for Breast Cancer" might be annotated to be about the variant 'BRCA2 c.8023A>G', and the disease 'Breast Cancer'. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: isAbout owner: Document domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: true contributions: name: contributions description: Specific actions taken by an Agent toward the creation, modification, validation, or deprecation of an Information Entity. comments: - This attribute holds one or more Contribution objects, which provide structured descriptions of a contribution made to the Information Entity by a particular agent. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: contributions owner: Document domain_of: - InformationEntity range: Contribution required: false multivalued: true dateAuthored: name: dateAuthored description: Indicates when the information content expressed in the Information Entity was generated. comments: - The term 'authored' as used in the model refers to the generation of 'information content' in the abstract sense, as opposed to a concrete encoding of this information in a specific language or format. e.g. for a Statement, this attribute captures when the information content expressed in the Statement was first generated by an agent. Information about when a particular concrete encoding of this information was created (e.g. as a written sentence, or a json object) would live in a RecordMetadata object attached to the Information Entity). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: dateAuthored owner: Document domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: false specifiedBy: name: specifiedBy description: A specification that describes all or part of the process that led to creation of the Information Entity (e.g. a specific experimental protocol or data analysis specification that describe how data were generated, or an evidence interpretation guideline that describes steps taken to interpret data in making a variant pathogenicity classification). comments: - Note that this attribute captures specific *instances* of specifications/methods (e.g. the specific electron microscopy method described in https://doi.org/10.1002/ cpz1.1045) - as opposed to reporting a *type* of method applied (e.g. 'Transmission Electron Microscopy'). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: specifiedBy owner: Document domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: true methodTypes: name: methodTypes description: Types of methodological approaches used to collect, generate, or evaluate the reported information. comments: - 'This field captures terms representing *types* of methods applied, vs the ''specifiedBy'' attribute which captures specific instances of methods used. Implementers should define a relevant source or specific set of method type codes/terms to use here based on the needs of the domain or application.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: methodTypes owner: Document domain_of: - InformationEntity range: Coding required: false multivalued: true derivedFrom: name: derivedFrom description: Another Information Entity from which this Information Entity is derived, in whole or in part from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: derivedFrom owner: Document domain_of: - InformationEntity range: InformationEntity required: false multivalued: true reportedIn: name: reportedIn description: A document in which the Information Entity is reported comments: - The term 'authored' is used in the model to refer to the generation of abstract 'information content', as opposed to creation of a concrete encoding of this information in a specific language, format, or physical artifact. e.g. for a Statement, this attribute captures when the information content expressed in the Statement was first generated by an agent, and metadata about when a particular concrete encoding of this information was created (e.g. a written sentence in an article, or json object in a data stream) would live in a RecordMetadata object attached to the Information Entity). from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: reportedIn owner: Document domain_of: - InformationEntity range: string required: false multivalued: true informationQuality: name: informationQuality description: A qualitative term indicating the scientific rigor or reliability with which the information was generated/collected. comments: - '- This is typically based on the quality of design and execution of the study or curation activity that generated it (e.g. were relevant controls assessed to show instruments were working, were all samples taken care of and handled identically, are methods sound and well documented, etc.). - The quality of information is intrinsic to the information itself, and not to a particular application of the information (e.g. as evidence for making an Assertion) - The quality of information is one factor that goes into the confidence we have in the information''s veracity (i.e. that it is an accurate reflection of reality it intends to measure or describe). Other factors informing confidence may include who did it (we may just not trust some Agents), when (if data created 500 years ago, we may have less confidence in it), and for Assertions, the relevance and abundance of supporting evidence. - Implementers should define a relevant source or specific set of terms to use here based on the needs of the domain or application.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: informationQuality owner: Document domain_of: - InformationEntity range: Coding required: false multivalued: false recordMetadata: name: recordMetadata description: Provenance metadata about a specific concrete encoding/serialization of information (e.g. as a record in a specific data/knowledgebase, or an online digital resource) - as opposed to provenance about the abstract information content a record carries. comments: - This attribute holds a structured RecordMetadata objects, which can be used to capture when, how, and by whom a record serialization was generated or modified; what upstream resources it was derived or retrieved from; and record-level administrative information such as versioning and lifecycle status. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: recordMetadata owner: Document domain_of: - InformationEntity range: RecordMetadata required: false multivalued: false id: name: id description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record, e.g. a UUID. This 'id' is unique within a given system, but may or may not be globally unique outside the system. It is used within a system to reference one object from another. comments: - 'FHIR naming conventions concerning ''logical'' vs ''business'' identifiers are adopted here. See https://confluence.hl7.org/display/SOA/FHIR+identifiers+and+FAIR+principles+on+IDs. Note that it is common for implementers to create their own internal logical ids - typically a serially or randomly generated value like a UUID that is assigned to the data object as it is created in a system. But an implementer may choose to reuse an existing, globally unique id from an external system or authority for this purpose (e.g. an HGNC id for a Gene object) - as long as it is unique within the implementing system, and can be used to reference the identified object in this context.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: id owner: Document domain_of: - Entity range: string required: true multivalued: false identifiers: name: identifiers description: A globally-unique 'business' identifier or accession number for the real-world entity represented by a data object. These are typically assigned by an external system or authority, and used to connect entities and share content across different systems. comments: - 'FHIR naming conventions concerning ''logical'' vs ''business'' identifiers are adopted here. See https://confluence.hl7.org/display/SOA/FHIR+identifiers+and+FAIR+principles+on+IDs. A given real world entity - e.g. a genetic variant - may have many business identifiers defined by different systems, which can be captured in the ''identifiers'' property to indicate that they represent the same thing. Preferred values for this attribute are CURIEs or URIs - so the system that provisioned the identifier is clear.' from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Informative rank: 1000 alias: identifiers owner: Document domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true type: name: type description: The name of the class that is instantiated by a data object representing the Entity. comments: - MUST be the label of a concrete class from the data model. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: type owner: Document domain_of: - Entity range: string required: true multivalued: false label: name: label description: A primary name for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: label owner: Document domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false alternativeLabels: name: alternativeLabels description: Alternative name(s) for the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: alternativeLabels owner: Document domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: true description: name: description description: A free text description of the Entity. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: description owner: Document domain_of: - Entity range: string required: false multivalued: false extensions: name: extensions description: A list of extensions to the Entity, that allow for capture of information not directly supported by elements defined in the model. comments: - Extension objects have a key-value data structure that allows definition of custom fields in the data itself. Extensions are not expected to be natively understood, but may be used for pre-negotiated exchange of message attributes between systems. from_schema: https://w3id.org/sepio-framework/sepio-linkml status: Draft rank: 1000 alias: extensions owner: Document domain_of: - Entity range: Extension required: false multivalued: true
